definition: to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Virgin Media has started trials to deliver fibre-optic high-speed broadband over telegraph poles.
sentences.chinese: 维珍传媒已开始试验使用电线杆架设高速光纤宽带。

sentences.english: Before long, the Red Cross began to pitch tents on high ground north of town.
sentences.chinese: 不久，红十字会开始在小镇北面的高地上架设帐篷。

sentences.english: You whish erections to last longer.
sentences.chinese: 您呼呼作声架设对前更长。

sentences.english: Full use of stents in-situ box girder erection, heap pressure on the overall pre-cast-in-place.
sentences.chinese: 现浇箱梁采用满堂支架架设，堆载预压整体现浇。

sentences.english: And in the depth of the valley, there must be a small bridge.
sentences.chinese: 而在那些山谷间，朝着深处去，也必然有小桥架设着。

sentences.english: The cost of putting a cable underground is between four and ten times as much as that of carrying it on a pylon.
sentences.chinese: 地下铺设电缆的造价是架设高空线塔的四到十倍。

sentences.english: Sufficient antenna wire and insulators shall be provided to enable a suitable antenna to be erected on board.
sentences.chinese: 应备有足够的天线和绝缘子，使能架设适当的天线。

sentences.english: The method of securing the scaffolding and plant shall be to the Jianli's approval.
sentences.chinese: 脚手架和设备的架设方法须经监理同意。

sentences.english: The role material quality, the scene material quality, erects the light.
sentences.chinese: 角色材质，场景材质，架设灯光。

sentences.english: Also is erects the common so-called electronic commerce website .
sentences.chinese: 也就是架设一般所谓的电子商务网站。

sentences.english: The 1, 318 kilometers of track needed for the link is being laid at a speed of around 12 kilometers a day.
sentences.chinese: 1318公里的路程需要每天架设12公里。

sentences.english: A new telegraph line has been set up between the two cities.
sentences.chinese: 那两个城市之间架设了一条新的电报线。

sentences.english: The soldiers threw a floating bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在河面架设了一座浮桥。

sentences.english: Machine-gun posts were set up at important points, and the wireless stations were seized.
sentences.chinese: 要害地点都架设了机枪，无线电台也被查封。

sentences.english: The erection of this framework took only a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 架设这个框架只需几分钟。

sentences.english: Or was he just setting up a camera on a soundstage?
sentences.chinese: 或者他只是在隔音场里架设摄像机？

definition: to install (water pipes, landmines etc) underground
to lay (railroad tracks, carpet, pipeline)/to install (wiring, cable)/to construct (road, concrete slab)
to install/to fit (e.g. a light bulb)
to construct by hoisting ready-built components into place
to build (esp. with simple materials)/to knock together (a temporary shed)/to rig up
to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
